column1:
Patch22,"2014-01-07T14:16:17.94Z","Flyer Beast vs Breez Review","

This is the first 2014 set I will be reviewing, and for a £

column2: s just like any Hero Factory set nowadays, it is packaged in a resealable

column1: Bag, which is always handy to keep LEGO pieces in.
The instructions are just like any other set really.
The parts in this set are very good if your into building Hero Factory Mocs.
Some of the Great parts you get in this set includes
New Feet, New Claws, Light Blue Bone Pieces(you get six), Flyer Beast'
column2: s head pieces and a Printed amour plate.

column1: The minifigure you get is Breez, she only come in this set so a lot of People will probably get this for the minifigure.
Breez is a very nice Minifigure, she has sliver amour and she has a transparent Orange Chain and she has her Rocket boots.
The Build is quite easy and can be done within ten minutes, but is still a very fun set to build.
The complete model is very nice and is very colourful, with Blue and Yellow
Pieces which will be great for Mocs, though his claw is a bit short,but it can be easily fixed.
There is also a piece on Flyer Beasts back which allows you to attach Breez onto Flyer Beasts back.
A great set, definitely worth picking up.
